result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve Deshunn Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
All Court costs, surcharges be paid through collection from any Court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
*1/2/2018 credit amended to 379 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs.
No possession of drug delivery paraphernalia:  syringes, scales, needles, multiple cell phones, etc.
May not possess more than $100.00 in cash at any given time.
No congtact with any known drug users or locations where drugs are trafficked/consumed.
No contact with Dareka B.

Follow all rules of supervision.
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also aedvised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steve Deshunn Young

Per Remittitur dated March 8, 2022, Appeal Nos 2020AP001142-CR (2015CF002008), 2020AP001143-CR (2016CF004778), and 2020AP001144-CR (2016CF005363), 
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in an opinion filed on December 28, 2021, that:
Judgments and order affirmed.

Per Order dated January 27, 2022, Appeal Nos 2020AP1142-CR (2015CF2008), 2020AP1143-CR (2016CF4778) and 2020AP1144-CR (2016CF5363).
IT IS ORDERED that this court will take no action on Young's January 19, 2022 filing.

Per Decision Dated and Filed December 28, 2021, Appeal Nos. 2020AP1142-CR, (2015CF2008), 2020AP1143-CR (2016CF4778), 2020AP1144-CR (2016CF5363), 
By the Court - Judgments and Order Affirmed. 
This opinion will not be published.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.23(21)(b)5. (2019-20).

Associated with Charge #1
Character Letters

Defendant Steve Deshunn Young in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Steve Deshunn Young in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
-No possession of drug delivery paraphernalia (syringes, scales, needles, multiple cell phones, etc). 
-Defendant may not possess more than $100.00 in cash at any given time. 
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
-No contact with any known drug users or locations where drugs are trafficked/consumed. 
- No contact with: Dareka B. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence     
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Letter from defendant.

Defendant Steve Deshunn Young in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Steve Deshunn Young in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steve Deshunn Young in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Defendant Steve Deshunn Young in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.   Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. There has already been a request for examination however, Dr. Collins was unable to make a determination as to competency. Therefore the defendant is ordered for inpatient evaluation at Mendota.   All parties are notified that pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 17-02 as of February 2, 2017 this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
